li.a: Title I, Title II, Title III

br.a: AskRose Online Homework Help (Now with extended daytime hours)

p.br: First, we want to say THANK YOU for your patience, flexibility and understanding as we all work through this unprecedented and fluid situation together! As you know, Governor Holcomb and Indiana State Superintendent of Public Instruction Dr. McCormick on Thursday announced that school buildings will remain closed for the rest of the 2019-2020 school year. Schools are expected to continue remote learning. The state is also allowing schools to use student waiver days. Due to these changes over safety concerns from the COVID-19 virus, we will continue our current eLearning structure until May 15th. May 15th will become the last student day, providing 165 days of instruction. This will provide our students with instruction into the middle of May. In addition, it will help our AP students who will begin their AP exams the week of May 18th. Please see the attachment for a visual guide to which days are student waiver days and which days are eLearning Days.

We know that students will need to come back to pick up their belongings. At this time, we plan on having students pick up their items during the weeks of May 18th and May 25th. More information in regards to the details of picking up items will be shared at a later date. Please know that this timeline could change based on an extended Stay At Home order by Governor Holcomb or Mayor Hogsett. In addition, we know that there have been many other questions. We have been adding your questions to our COVID-19 eLearning FAQ website page. Please read our updated COVID-19 FAQ – https://ftcsc.org/covid-19/. After you read our COVID-19 FAQ, if you still have questions, please email your child’s building principal. In addition, please continue to visit our COVID-19 Info page as we will continue to update our FAQ during this unprecedented event.

In closing, we again say THANK YOU for your amazing support during this unprecedented event. Our last student school day will be May 15th. Please visit our COVID-19 and eLearning websites for help and support during remote learning. In addition, if you have technology problems during remote learning, remember you can call our Information Technology Department for support at 317-803-5357.

div.p: Gov. Holcomb’s COVID-19 Executive Orders – https://www.in.gov/gov/2384.htm

Gov. Holcomb’s Executive Order (To close schools for 19-20 School Year) – https://mcusercontent.com/8134ab71fa4d5aa8794bbf147/files/02df95f2-2cc4-4790-b2a5-0ea28727e8c8/Executive_Order_20_16_Education.pdf

Indiana State Superintendent of Public Instruction Guidance on Graduation Requirements – https://mcusercontent.com/8134ab71fa4d5aa8794bbf147/files/e3338e6f-6807-4636-a091-1b8b33659fc8/Graduation_Requirements_FINAL_4.2.20_002_.pdf
Press release from Marion County superintendents- https://s3-us-east-2.amazonaws.com/franklinschoolcorp/Covid-19.FTCSCclosing.pdf
